intro: Cadetia microphyton, commonly known as the small-leaved cadetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit with a short stem and is often found in temperate regions of Europe. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in many areas.
